channel.title: Moparscape problems? Please help
channel.description:
After I extracted everything, I tried to open Moparscape and it said
'Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable file, or batch file.
Press any key to continue...
Then it just closes. Does anybody know how to fix this?
Also, I hear scar is built into moparscape, is this safe to use? I'm only asking because the old one from kaitnieks says that it's not working yet and there will be an updated scar blah blah blah, I'm sure everybody knows what I'm talking about. I was a part of Kaitnieks for a long time, so please don't think I'm leeching, I only just found this site today.

item.title: Moparscape problems? Please help
item.dc:creator: @Riven89 Riven89
item.description:
@Riven89 wrote:

Yea I got that like 20 mins ago, now I'm trying to figure out how to get onto a server :(. Heh

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape problems? Please help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Riven89:

Hey, I got it working, but I can't get to the second line to put my password in, nor can I get to the thirt line. What do I do?

try clicking them and pressing the enter button

oh and just type, even if the yellow cursor isnt blinking

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape problems? Please help
item.dc:creator: @Riven89 Riven89
item.description:
@Riven89 wrote:

Ok, I think I got the right one. Now when I try to open "runmoparscape" I get a big list of things.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.unsupportedclassversionerror: Bot unsupported major.minor version 49.0>

Man, I suck lol.[br][size=1]Posted at: April 11, 2006, 12:16:42 pm[/size][hr]Hmm, when I click the mopar.jar file it says could not find main class and exits.[br][size=1]Posted at: April 11, 2006, 12:36:09 pm[/size][hr]Hey, I got it working, but I can't get to the second line to put my password in, nor can I get to the thirt line. What do I do?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape problems? Please help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

then you need to install the latest java runtime (jre) from java.sun.com

and if the batch file still doesnt work, try double clicking the mopar.jar

Read full topic
